metadata.name: AF1960S Mozambique #1
metadata.description:
This is the first-ever NFT collection, on any platform, of classic historical photographs taken in Africa.

This collection comprises 50 photographs taken, on 35mm black & white film, by my grandfather Américo Ferreira in Mozambique, Africa, in the 1960s.

Each person portrayed on this collection, when photographed 6 decades ago on a remote location, wouldn’t envision a digital future. All of them are now transported, through space and time, to the global-stage of cutting-edge blockchain technology - their existence preserved, honoured and (hopefully) celebrated forever.

These 50 NFTs were created by carefully photographing original darkroom prints with a modern digital medium-format camera - respecting and conserving these photographs including all marks on paper developed with time.

1/1 JPEG 2257 × 3545 pixels
All NFT sale proceeds will be spent in Mozambique.
